articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Sixteen-year-old Ali Edis is passionate about innovative tech and nature, so he combined the two by tweaking a drone’s control system so you can fly it by touching different fruits. Yes. Fruits. His aim is to encourage more young people to engage with the natural sciences and conservation through creative technology. How does capacitive touch […]
The post Fly a drone by touching Raspberry Pi-connected fruit appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Fly a drone by touching Raspberry Pi-connected fruit

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Sticker Heist is a fun, hands-on approach to learning the basics of cybersecurity. It is the brainchild of Ohio-based college professor Dr Mike, and built around Raspberry Pi 4. 
The post Pull off a Sticker Heist to learn about cybersecurity appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Pull off a Sticker Heist to learn about cybersecurity

articles.author: Rosie Hattersley
articles.description:
Blackpool’s world-famous illuminations provided the setting for an interactive project that features Raspberry Pi. In the latest issue of The MagPi, Rosie Hattersley gets enlightened. Wintertime illuminated walks and interactive art shows have proved extremely popular over the past few years. Blackpool’s Odyssey lights combine the two, adding to the appeal of the renowned annual […]
The post Odyssey Lights at Blackpool Illuminations appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Odyssey Lights at Blackpool Illuminations

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
We've created a tutorial to walk you through building a toy chatterbox — a neat example of what Raspberry Pi Audio Boards can do.
The post How to build a toy chatterbox appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: How to build a toy chatterbox

articles.author: Andrew Gregory
articles.description:
Starting with an obsession with modular printed robots, then MicroPython, then livestreaming, Kevin has built up kevsrobots.com into a great resource for anyone who wants to get started.
The post Meet Kevin McAleer: Teacher, maker, builder, programmer, 3D printer, and all-round Renaissance man appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Meet Kevin McAleer: Teacher, maker, builder, programmer, 3D printer, and all-round Renaissance man

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Raspberry Pi has been harnessed at Vineyard Kikushima in Japan to keep pesticide use to a minimum and the wine tasting great.
The post Japanese vineyard makes excellent wine with Raspberry Pi appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Japanese vineyard makes excellent wine with Raspberry Pi

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
A research team in Victoria, Australia, used Raspberry Pi to keep an eye on honey bees pollinating strawberry crops. Their aim is to develop an affordable, automated pollination monitoring system.
The post Pi-powered pollination monitors support farming in Australia appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Pi-powered pollination monitors support farming in Australia

articles.author: Rob Zwetsloot
articles.description:
Pi Wars may famously be an offshoot of CamJam, but it’s not just limited to makers from that pocket of England. It's reached the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico thanks to makerspace organiser Alex Martinez.
The post Meet Alex Martinez: bringing computing education and making to Puerto Rico appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Meet Alex Martinez: bringing computing education and making to Puerto Rico

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Meet Alpakka: a customisable, open source gaming pad with additional features to improve performance and improve accessibility.
The post Build your own accessible Alpakka gaming controller appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Build your own accessible Alpakka gaming controller

articles.author: Rob Zwetsloot
articles.description:
This groundbreaking device aids walking while understanding that people move in different ways, as David Crookes explains in the latest issue of The MagPi. 
The post Exoskeleton walking aid | The MagPi #126 appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Exoskeleton walking aid | The MagPi #126
